title: Battle of the Royal dressmakers as books about two of Queen's stylists published on same day
text:
As some of the Queen’s most trusted confidentes, those who dress Her Majesty are privy to secrets her admirers can only dream of.

Some take them to their grave, others wait decades to share even the most benign of anecdotes. And then, like buses, the memoirs of two come along at once.

This month will two of the Queen’s best-known royal dressmakers go head-to-head, in what may prove the publishing sensation of the season.

On October 29, Angela Kelly, the current reigning dressmaker at Buckingham Palace, will publish tales of her “uniquely close working relationship with The Queen”, becoming the first serving member of the Royal Household to be granted that “extraordinary permission”.

On the...
